Problem:
Consider a system described by a set of linear algebraic equations driven by a matrix function \\( X(t) = e^{At}X_0 \\), where A is a diagonalizable matrix. We further examine the effect of an integral transformation \\( g(X) = \\int_0^T e^{-At}X(t) dt \\) on the system.

If the transformation \\( g(X) \\) is applied at time t = 0 to the matrix \\( X_0 \\) and then the system evolves according to \\( X(t) = e^{At}X_0 \\) until time T, will the resultant matrix \\( X(T) \\) be identical to that obtained by direct evolution of \\( X_0 \\) under the same equation without applying \\( g(X) \\)?
Explanation: Applying \\( g(X) \\) initially influences the system by altering the state with an integral transformation. This change in the system's initial condition indirectly modifies the evolution path of \\( X(t) \\), which will generally result in a different matrix at time T compared to the state obtained without applying \\( g(X) \\).
